action.action-desc: Ms. Stefanik (for herself and Mr. Gallagher) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To direct the Federal Communications Commission to publish a list of entities that hold authorizations, licenses, or other grants of authority issued by the Commission and that have certain foreign ownership, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Adversary Communications Transparency Act.

section.header: List of entities holding FCC authorizations, licenses, or other grants of authority and having certain foreign ownership

subsection.text: Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commission shall publish on the internet website of the Commission a list of each entity—

subparagraph.text: an authorization issued by the Commission;
a license issued by the Commission; or
any other grant of authority issued by the Commission; and
10 percent or more of the equity interest (or equivalent thereof) of which is owned by—

clause.text: multiple covered entities, in the aggregate; or

subparagraph.text: that is not covered by subparagraph (A) but that the Commission, in consultation with an appropriate national security agency, considers appropriate.

subsection.text: The Commission shall update the list published under subsection (a) not less frequently than annually.

paragraph.text: The term appropriate national security agency has the meaning given such term in section 9 of the Secure and Trusted Communications Networks Act of 2019 (47 U.S.C. 1608).
The term Commission means the Federal Communications Commission.

subparagraph.text: the government of a covered country;
an entity organized under the laws of a covered country or otherwise subject to the jurisdiction of the government of a covered country; and

a subsidiary or affiliate of an entity described in subparagraph (B) that is not organized under the laws of a covered country or otherwise subject to the jurisdiction of the government of a covered country.
